poem:
Title: "The Quarry of Quietness"

Within bounds of concrete and steel,
A quarter share their lock and seal.
Two shadows cast by a single lamp,
In the quiet quarry of the cramp.
Justice weeps, and walls eavesdrop,
On freedom's dart without a stop.
Half the air, and half the prayers,
In the gloom, the burden wears.
Two dreams sown in one worn thread,
In solitary's woven bed.
